name: pymongo
appConfig:
#Use this function to connect to your MongoDB database and retrive the connection when you need it
def get_db():
	client = MongoClient('localhost', 27017, username='username', password='password')
	return client['mydb']
 # Sample usage
 # db = get_db() 
 # collection = db['mycollection']
 # collection.insert_one({'name': 'John Doe', 'email': 'example@email.com'})'
description: pymongo is a Python driver for MongoDB that allows you to connect to MongoDB databases
readme:
- MongoDB: Use the get_db function to connect to your database and retrieve the connection when you need it
	Make sure to replace the connection string with your own values
	You can use the connection object to interact with your database which is named mydb
	For more information, refer to the official documentation at https://pypi.org/project/pymongo/
